page.title: 20WINSON
page.content: Winson lies mostly in a loop road which starts at the church and encircles most of the village. The number of residents on the Parliamentary Electoral roll is 63, but about one third of the houses are unoccupied except at weekends. The residents here are either connected with farming or retired and professional people. The largest farm is the "Village Farm". Old Manor Farm is the oldest and least altered house, with beautiful gardens in which peacocks proudly strut. Manor House used to be a farmhouse but was drastically altered in 1748 to resemble a Grand House in the 18. Century style. Winson is rich in stone carving and few houses are less than 200 years old.
